verses.verse: Then <S%H347>Job<s%> <S%H6030>answered,<s%>
"In <S%H551>truth<s%> I <S%H3045>know<s%> that this is <S%H3651>so,<s%> But <S%H4100>how<s%> can a <S%H582>man<s%> be in the <S%H6663>right<s%> <S%H5973>before<s%> <S%H410>God<s%>?
<S%H518>"If<s%> one <S%H2654>wished<s%> to <S%H7378>dispute<s%> with Him, He could not <S%H6030>answer<s%> Him <S%H259>once<s%> in a <S%H505>thousand<s%> [times.]
<S%H2450>"Wise<s%> in <S%H3824>heart<s%> and <S%H533>mighty<s%> in <S%H3581>strength,<s%> <S%H4310>Who<s%> has <S%H7185>defied<s%> <S%H413><s%> Him <S%H9608>without<s%> <S%H9608>harm<s%>?
"[It is God] who <S%H6275>removes<s%> the <S%H2022>mountains,<s%> they <S%H3045>know<s%> not [how,] <S%H834>When<s%> He <S%H2015>overturns<s%> them in His <S%H639>anger;<s%>
Who <S%H7264>shakes<s%> the <S%H776>earth<s%> out of its <S%H4725>place,<s%> And its <S%H5982>pillars<s%> <S%H6426>tremble;<s%>
Who <S%H559>commands<s%> the <S%H2775>sun<s%> not to <S%H2224>shine,<s%> And <S%H2856>sets<s%> a <S%H2856>seal<s%> upon the <S%H3556>stars;<s%>
Who <S%H905>alone<s%> <S%H5186>stretches<s%> out the <S%H8064>heavens,<s%> And <S%H1869>tramples<s%> <S%H1869>down<s%> the <S%H1116>waves<s%> of the <S%H3220>sea;<s%>
Who <S%H6213>makes<s%> the <S%H5906>Bear,<s%> <S%H3685>Orion,<s%> and the <S%H3598>Pleiades,<s%> And the <S%H2315>chambers<s%> of the <S%H8486>south;<s%>

Who <S%H6213>does<s%> <S%H1419>great<s%> <S%H1419>things,<s%> <S%H2714>unfathomable<s%><S%H369>,<s%> <S%H5704><s%> And <S%H6381>wondrous<s%> <S%H6381>works<s%> <S%H5704>without<s%> <S%H369><s%> <S%H4557>number.<s%>
"Were He to <S%H5674>pass<s%> by me, I would not <S%H7200>see<s%> Him; Were He to <S%H2498>move<s%> <S%H2498>past<s%> [me,] I would not <S%H995>perceive<s%> Him.
"Were He to <S%H2862>snatch<s%> <S%H2862>away,<s%> <S%H4310>who<s%> could <S%H7725>restrain<s%> Him? <S%H4310>Who<s%> could <S%H559>say<s%> to Him, <S%H4100>'What<s%> art Thou <S%H6213>doing<s%>?'
<S%H433>"God<s%> will not <S%H7725>turn<s%> <S%H7725>back<s%> His <S%H639>anger;<s%> <S%H8478>Beneath<s%> Him <S%H7817>crouch<s%> the <S%H5826>helpers<s%> of <S%H7293>Rahab.<s%>
<S%H637>"How<s%> <S%H637>then<s%> <S%H3588><s%> can I <S%H6030>answer<s%> Him, [And] <S%H977>choose<s%> my <S%H1697>words<s%> <S%H5973>before<s%> Him?
"For <S%H518>though<s%> I were <S%H6663>right,<s%> I could not <S%H6030>answer;<s%> I would have to <S%H2603>implore<s%> the <S%H2603>mercy<s%> of my <S%H8199>judge.<s%>
<S%H518>"If<s%> I <S%H7121>called<s%> and He <S%H6030>answered<s%> me, I could not <S%H539>believe<s%> that He was <S%H238>listening<s%> to my <S%H6963>voice.<s%>
"For He <S%H7779>bruises<s%> me with a <S%H8183>tempest,<s%> And <S%H7235>multiplies<s%> my <S%H6482>wounds<s%> <S%H2600>without<s%> <S%H2600>cause.<s%>
"He will not <S%H5414>allow<s%> me to <S%H7725>get<s%> my <S%H7307>breath,<s%> But <S%H7646>saturates<s%> me with <S%H4472>bitterness.<s%>

<S%H518>"If<s%> [it is a matter] of <S%H3581>power,<s%> <S%H2009>behold,<s%> [He is] the <S%H533>strong<s%> <S%H533>one!<s%> And <S%H518>if<s%> [it is a matter] of <S%H4941>justice,<s%> <S%H4310>who<s%> can <S%H3259>summon<s%> Him?
<S%H518>"Though<s%> I am <S%H6663>righteous,<s%> my <S%H6310>mouth<s%> will <S%H7561>condemn<s%> me; Though I am <S%H8535>guiltless,<s%> He will <S%H6140>declare<s%> me <S%H6140>guilty.<s%>
"I am <S%H8535>guiltless;<s%> I do not <S%H3045>take<s%> <S%H3045>notice<s%> of <S%H5315>myself;<s%> I <S%H3988>despise<s%> my <S%H9132>life.<s%>
"It is [all] <S%H259>one;<s%> <S%H5921>therefore<s%> <S%H3651><s%> I <S%H559>say,<s%> 'He <S%H3615>destroys<s%> the <S%H8535>guiltless<s%> and the <S%H7563>wicked.<s%>'
<S%H518>"If<s%> the <S%H7752>scourge<s%> <S%H4191>kills<s%> <S%H6597>suddenly,<s%> He <S%H3932>mocks<s%> the <S%H9275>despair<s%> of the <S%H9345>innocent.<s%>

"The <S%H776>earth<s%> is <S%H5414>given<s%> into the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked;<s%> He <S%H3680>covers<s%> the <S%H6440>faces<s%> of its <S%H8199>judges.<s%> <S%H518>If<s%> [it is] not [He,] <S%H645>then<s%> <S%H4310>who<s%> is it?
"Now my <S%H3117>days<s%> are <S%H7043>swifter<s%> <S%H4480>than<s%> a <S%H7323>runner;<s%> They <S%H1272>flee<s%> <S%H1272>away,<s%> they <S%H7200>see<s%> <S%H3808>no<s%> <S%H9186>good.<s%>
"They <S%H2498>slip<s%> by <S%H5973>like<s%> <S%H16>reed<s%> <S%H591>boats,<s%> Like an <S%H5404>eagle<s%> that <S%H2907>swoops<s%> on its <S%H400>prey.<s%>
<S%H518>"Though<s%> I <S%H559>say,<s%> 'I will <S%H7911>forget<s%> my <S%H7879>complaint,<s%> I will <S%H5800>leave<s%> off my [sad] <S%H6440>countenance<s%> and be <S%H1082>cheerful,<s%>'
I am <S%H3025>afraid<s%> of <S%H3605>all<s%> my <S%H6094>pains,<s%> I <S%H3045>know<s%> that Thou wilt not <S%H5352>acquit<s%> me.
"I am accounted <S%H7561>wicked,<s%> <S%H4100>Why<s%> <S%H2088>then<s%> should I <S%H3021>toil<s%> in <S%H1892>vain<s%>?
<S%H518>"If<s%> I should <S%H7364>wash<s%> myself with <S%H7950>snow<s%> And <S%H2141>cleanse<s%> my <S%H3709>hands<s%> with <S%H1253>lye,<s%>
<S%H227>Yet<s%> Thou wouldst <S%H2881>plunge<s%> me into the <S%H7845>pit,<s%> And my own <S%H8008>clothes<s%> would <S%H8581>abhor<s%> me.
"For [He is] not a <S%H376>man<s%> as I am that I may <S%H6030>answer<s%> Him, That we may <S%H935>go<s%> to <S%H4941>court<s%> <S%H9191>together.<s%>
<S%H3426>"There<s%> is <S%H3808>no<s%> <S%H3198>umpire<s%> <S%H996>between<s%> us, Who may <S%H7896>lay<s%> his <S%H3027>hand<s%> upon us <S%H8147>both.<s%>
"Let Him <S%H5493>remove<s%> His <S%H7626>rod<s%> from me, And let not <S%H367>dread<s%> of Him <S%H1204>terrify<s%> me.
"[Then] I would <S%H1696>speak<s%> and not <S%H3372>fear<s%> Him; But I am not <S%H3651>like<s%> that in myself.
